title: STUNS AREN'T A COUNTER
body:
Whenever a champion being broken is brought up, whether it is on the Boards, Reddit or somewhere else, there is always people showing up saying "he/she isn't op, just stun them".

With that logic, no champion in the game is broken, because "you can just stun them". And if that was the case, everyone would pick a champ that has hard-cc.

Stun Yi? Good luck when he's alpha striking all over the place.
Stun Katarina? Good luck when she blinks three times in a fight (Oh, and Kata can oneshot you without her ult)

"Stunning" someone isn't counterplay.

Not being skilled enough to hit someone with an ability isn't a reason to say something doesn't have counterplay

I got flamed once because I was playing lux and struggling to land my root on a master yi. The worst part is that they apparently didn't know the difference between a root and a stun because they kept saying "land your stun." Even worse still is it was a heimerdinger. If it's so easy then why don't they land their stun on the yi. Lol. You literally have to have multiple abilities with hard cc between at least a couple people just to guarantee you can stop the yi because he's so hard to hit. Or have point and click cc like a lulu ult on the person yi goes in on. It's hard to pick into a yi though if he's one of the last people in champ select.
Rooting master yi is the same as stunning.
Most noobs think that Lux and Morgana Q is a stun. Reguardless of what the difference is on Yi, almost 70% of the people I support with Morgana think she stuns with her Q.

Yes, but that wasn't the first time or the last time I'd heard those words. I play Zyra a lot and in my elo people get upset if you miss even once. There have been times where I missed her root (because mobility is a thing) and been told to land my "stun" and not even necessarily on a melee champ who relies on auto attacking. I think it's just a low elo thing. :/
Provided he wasn't already on top of you and can get an extra few autos off, then meditate in place if it looks like he'll take too much return damage.

Of course it is. 
If your opponents picked a high mobility champion and you picked nothing to lock them down you missed an opportunity for counterplay. If you waste your cc on a low priority enemy and get punished you missed an opportunity for counterplay. Even not using cc is counterplay since your opponent might not dare to engage when it's still available.

> With that logic, no champion in the game is broken, because "you can just stun them". And if that was the case, everyone would pick a champ that has hard-cc.

I agree, cc is useful against many champions, but there's always a trade-off. I you pick hard cc you will sacrifice damage, mobility or other useful stats for it. Your team needs a little bit to ground mobile opponents or kite, but any more than necessary will hurt your team.

> Stun Yi? Good luck when he's alpha striking all over the place.
Stun Katarina? Good luck when she blinks three times in a fight (Oh, and Kata can oneshot you without her ult)

Just because it's challenging doesn't mean it's not counterplay. Quite the opposite, you can easily hit Yi directly after his Q, but Yi can save his Q until you use your cc. This creates an interesting environment of anticipation and execution both sides have to play around. That's like the very definition of counterplay.
Doesn't even have to be a stun, a snare, a root, any hard CC will do, but if your team comp is so crappy that you don't have any hard CC, you don't have any right to complain when you lose.

Yup

Actually yes, they are (in general).

The issue comes only if the only way to neutralize the champion after the stun is that 5 ppl instantly jump on them and kill them before the stun expires.

Let me make some examples:

- **Yasuo** got stunned during a dive, he is done for as he has no ways to escape (unless there is a wave of minions running down to safety)  nor the life steal to sustain himself if he gets out of the stun alive.
- **Zed** got stunned during a dive, jokes on you, he can instantly teleport to a shadow in his fountain.
- **Yi** got stunned during a dive, like you are going to kill him after he Alpha Strikes your squishies into golds for him and then heals himself back to full by either attacking or meditating on how skilled he is.

Yes, CC is a counter. Not every champ is equally hurt by CC.

If you stun amumu, he is likely going to survive the CC.

If you CC a burst mage after their rotation, they already did their job.

If you CC an ADC or a melee hyper carry, they likely dont have the stats to survive the duration.

If you CC a melee champion, it makes it much less likely that they will be able to get in range before your ranged champs pick them off.


So yes, CC is a valid counter.

This kind of game logic falls under what I call "all you gotta do is" fallacy.

The concept of "all you gotta do is" that there is never a problem with a boss, character, item, or other issue in a game because it can be dealt with very simply because all you gotta do is _stun, dodge, use X ability, play X character, gang up on, etc_. them and you win!

Give an example of how dumb "all you gotta do" is...

**The new character in "Der Awezum Anime Gurl Dule 31"manga isnt OP. The main characters can easily defeat her. All you gotta do is sneak up on her while shes sleeping, set up about 10 kg of explosives in direct contact with her legs without waking her up, then get clear and set them off... thats all you gotta do!**

The thing about the fallacy is it is used often as a justification for something being excessive by simply offering up a solution that would counter ANYTHING, and sometimes even still doesn't counter the problem in the worst cases.

The fallacy is pretty common in pvp games with CC chains, or character combos that can put anything down. So long as their is SOME kind of inescapable combo or chain then nothing can be OP cause... say it with me... "all you gotta do is."

OOF. I mean Katarina's only real way of killing someone who hasn't seriously outplayed is to ult, and stunning is how you counter it. Yi is a champion that preys on stupidity, his kit is entirely designed to do so, and if you stun him he dies. 

Obviously there are champions that are broken that unfortunately nothing can really deal with like pre nerf Aatrox, but Kat and Yi are horrible examples as their kits are literally countered by any stun in the game. If you cant land the stun, you misplayed against those two. Neither champion is broken, just play better.

> STUNS AREN'T A COUNTER

***YES, they are***

Here is the difference between stunning a DPS like {{champion:11}} and {{champion:29}}. When you are grouped, Yi has no choice but to dive in to your team to get a carry. This makes it drastically more easy to land a stun on him. Then guess what? He's a glass cannon DPS stuck in the middle of your team and gets blown up in 1 second. This is different than someone like Twitch who is 700 units away behind his team making it ***drastically*** more difficult to stun him.

Jesus christ this is basic logic
